All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Admin
The Admin class, as a child class of Employee, provides all the methods to administrate the entire system in addition to having all the Employee's methods
AdminSignUpController
This class manages the sign-up scene for the administrator account
CardController
This class manages the data contained in the product cards of the user interface
Constants
The Constants class defines the utilities needed for the proper funcitoning of the software
Employee
The Employee, as a child class of Person, provides all the necessary methods to complete the tasks of an employee.
EmployeeController
This class provides all the necessary methods to manage the employee interface
FileManager
The FileManager class defines a Filemanager object:
LoginController
Controller Class of the login scene, also manages the interactions with the connected scenes.
Main
This class contains the public static void main of the application
MyListener
This interface defines abstract methods that are defined in different classes, providing different functionalities to different parts of the application
Order
The Order class, extension of the Product class, defines an order object:
OrderController
This class provides all the necessary methods to fill and manage an order row in the employee interface
Person
The Person, as a parent class, provides the elementary methods and attributes for its child classes
PersonController
This class provides all the necessary methods to fill and manage a person row in the employee interface
Product
The Product class defines a product object:
ProductController
This class provides all the necessary methods to fill and manage a product row in the employee interface
User
The User class, as a child class of Person, provides all the necessary methods and attributes for all the user tasks
UserController
This class provides all the necessary methods to manage the user interface
Utilities
This class provides utilities to the module, for example the ShowAlert method that takes as input title, header and content and produces an alert window
Warehouse
The Warehouse class defines a warehouse object
